wiki.summary: In “Tried Our Best”, Drake delves into the intricate dynamics of a complex romantic relationship. The lyrics shed light on the challenges and conflicts that frequently arise between the singer and his partner. Drake’s narrative hints at his desire to experience certain moments and places alone, possibly to evade arguments or disagreements with his significant other. This longing for solitary moments underscores the strain in the relationship. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: In “Tried Our Best”, Drake delves into the intricate dynamics of a complex romantic relationship. The lyrics shed light on the challenges and conflicts that frequently arise between the singer and his partner. Drake’s narrative hints at his desire to experience certain moments and places alone, possibly to evade arguments or disagreements with his significant other. This longing for solitary moments underscores the strain in the relationship. The chorus, marked by the repetition of “Treat you right,” serves as a poignant reminder of the singer’s aspiration to establish a healthy and harmonious connection. It encapsulates his yearning for an improved state of affairs. In the second verse, Drake delves deeper into the relationship’s troubles, addressing issues like late nights, substance use, and emotional turbulence. His candidness about these struggles conveys a sense of frustration and difficulty in restoring equilibrium. It’s evident that the relationship is taking a toll on both Drake and his partner. Throughout the song, listeners encounter Drake’s signature wordplay and references. For instance, he playfully likens himself to Shakespeare, showcasing his lyrical prowess. He also engages in wordplay related to Yves Saint Laurent (YSL) and the term “gay friends,” adding a layer of wit to the song. In sum, this track offers a profound exploration of a romantic relationship marked by conflict, misunderstandings, and a fervent desire for reconciliation. The song’s emotional depth and Drake’s lyrical finesse make it a compelling narrative of love’s complexities. Read more on Last.fm.
